comments.text: Walked down a bit the road with a sign Ghent, got a direct ride within 5 mins. Lots of parking space for car to pull by along the whole road to the south
Perfect to go to Ghent
Amazing spot. I only waited 2 minutes. It was a tuesday at 4pm.
1 guy 1 girl got a ride in around 2-3 mins, lucked out and he was going all the way to Gent. Around midday on a Monday. There's a petrol station straight after a set of lights.
got a ride to brussels in 5min

I hitchhiked on the parking and got a ride in less than 5 minutes. 
When flying to Finland, I was waiting after the check-in and just started asking people. I found a ride Turku - Helsinki. It saved me a lot of time and money
I got a lift towards Liege in 2 minutes. The spot is great, you can stand on narrow, heightened pavement separating the car park from the road. You'll be more visible with a sign

Other possibility is to go in front of the machine were the driver are paying the parking and to ask them directly... very succesfull
I hitchiked from there to Brussels, Antwerp and Luxembourg. This place is very good so i gave 3 waiting times.

A guy and a girl on a Thursday at noon without a sign. It was a good spot : there is little place to stop, but traffic is good and slow. It might be a bit dangerous, but not so much and two cars stopped to help us in 10min. We got a ride with the second car to the petrol station in the direction of Brussels.
Also possible to get to Luxembourg direction, you just have to wait longer.
perfect ! and more than perfect if you have a sign :)
On y trouve des lifts même à trois heures du mat' le week end  :)
Best place ever. I've never wait more than 10min during the rush hours !

aquí me dejo un auto que me traía de Breda ! eran tipo 4 de la tarde (sabado) y estaba lloviendo, yo iba a Lille, me hice en la salida de la estacion y fue muy dificil, por que no tenia un letrero de adonde iba, crei que me tocaria dormir esa noche hay, pero por suerte del mundo un carro paro y me llevo a 30 minutos de lille y me ofrecio hospedaje en su casa ya que la persona con la que me iba a hospedar no aparecio. para los que no son de europa como yo, esa estacion tiene wifi gratis pero solo
waited one hour a bit behind the petrol station with a sign saying "France". After warming up for 5 minutes in the station I was able to get somebody to take me up to Rouen! was great

As we didn't speak French that good , we decided to stand by the exit of petrol station with a sign to Lille (FR). Wasn't a good idea. After half-an-hour spent there we went back and 15 minutes later got a car from petrol station directly to Lille. (2 people)
We were two girls waiting near the exit, didn't go to anyone. But within 15 min we got on a car heading for Amiens. It was a Sunday morning.

a really good spot to go south. In the direction of Paris. It s possible to reach by going through the little town along the highway. There s a little way parallel to it. Though then you have to cross a fence to reach the petrol station. About 2m high though easy to climb. I did it that way since there s no space to walk right next to the highway, so it s dangerous to walk on the highway. It s about 1-2 km from the entrance of the highway. From the center, it s possible to take the metro till St

Held sign saying Antwerp/E17. Lots of space to pull over but not a lot of spots where cars are looking your way. 

My driver was heading to Brussels but decided to take me to Antwerp in the end.
Nice spot
The first guy I asked took me and it was around 10 pm.
Really good place for transfers
Wednesday evening, the third person we asked took us to Antwerp, our ride to this station wasn't even gone yet.
large service station. 5min at the exit with a sign to brügge
Perfect spot for Brugge directions. We got lift in 5 mins. We also tried to ask people directly, but that wasn't successful, but with a sign in less that 5 min success came :)
Good station if you can get this far out of town, as every one will be headed to Brugge, Oostende or Calais direction. We got a quick lift to sevice station by Veurne very quickly.
I waited 10 minutes (Fr 11:30pm). Most cars go to Oostende, few to Calais.
busy gas station direction Brugge/Oostend
I stood by the traffic lights. got a lift amost till gehnt in 40 min

In theory a good spot I think, but a bit more difficult for cars to stop when the entire strip on the right is filled with parked cars like we had. In any case, we got picked up at 11:30 pm in about 12min. so it definitely wasn't bad
Good spot to get to Brussels, Gent Brugge ... (to get here you can take the ''ring bus''
Make a board with your destination after brussels; maybe you get lucky and get there in one ride. I got picked up four times there and always further then Brussels!
To Brussells

First Person I asked (german number plate) took me all the way to east Germany. (8h drive)

There must be quite a lot of channel traffic be passing through.
The first guy I asked took me to Gent.
Got a lift to Brussels just sitting down on our backpacks and asking the first car that came by if he's going to Brussels.
I waited here almost 4 hours, but took a lift by truck directly to Czechia.

This is a great spot both for short distance using commuter traffic (I would suggest standing with a sign just after the pedestrian crossing towards the small park on the south western part of the station) and long distance journeys with the trucks. Got a ride to Brussels in 10 minutes!

Very good spot, there is space to stop and the cars are going a reasonable speed. I did get stopped by the police while i was walking to the spot. In the end they did tell me it is okay to hitchhike there, so no problems.
got a lift to lille super easy
Dirrect lift to ANTWERPEN after 1min. Belgium is so nice again.
used a sign with Gent written on and got a ride in the first car that went by

good spot for E40 in both directions
lots of space and cars are slow after the roundabout
Good Place, took me 10 minutes to get a ride in direction to Hasselt.
Only waited 5 minutes before getting a lift in a lorry to Eindhoven. Good visibility and space for vehicles.
Got a lift to Dusseldorf after 45 minutes waiting.
More cars seem to take the E34 to Turnhout and Eindhoven than the E313. Also very few cars that pass by Liège. Most German cars take the E313 and 314 to Aachen.
A quite busy gas station. Many trucks.
Hitched here June 2019, direction Brugge. Got a direct ride offer to Ghent in 15 mins, and another ride to 25km towards Brugge in another 15 min. Lots of space for car to pull by
Great spot in walking distance from city centre. Got direct ride to Brugge under 5 minutes.
Good stop, traffic lights so everyone has to stop, in different directions, heading to the highway.
direction Ghent, Bruges, coast. bus 36 or the tram for antwerp center. gone in ten min.
Was hitchhiking to Ghent with a friend (brought a sign), the 12th car stopped (a Tesla!!) and brought us to Ghent :)
Pretty good spot to go to Ghent, Courtrai, Hulst (NL) or the sea.
This was the third time I used this spot and again, I was amazed how smooth you can get a ride here. For three times, I never had to wait more than 10 minutes. A sign with a direction will help you.
Great spot! for going towards Ghent/France.  Lots of room to pull over. Waited 3 minutes.

Had a bad luck day trying to move to Liège. It was -2C and still cars didn't stop before 1 hour, when a couple of seniors took me to another exit of the city where I could have a chance. I definitely accepted since winds a lot here! Hehe
Got a ride to Brussels in 5 minutes. There is a park right beside the road, so cars can stop without problems.
Immediat pick-up to Antwerp via Brussels. The best place to stand to leave Leuven.
Barely put my arm out and got picked up within 10 seconds... Great to get to Brussels.
We hardly had to wait, a car to Rotterdam dropped us of in Ghent
You can hitchhike in the evening aswell. Big lights. Moderate traffic.
Good hitchiking spot to go to Gent, cars can park easily on the side of the road.
Good spot to go to Brussels. Got a ride in 5min
petrol station, direction Brussels

Great busy petrol station with lots of cars going south and in our case to Brussels. Was dropped of here from another ride. I only approached I think 3 people before finding someone taking me and my friend all the way to Brussels
Good for going south! I was hiking with my girlfriend going to Charleroi. Lots of people stopping here because it is the only pertrol station between Antwerp and Brussels on this Highway.

Petrol station Waarloos. 
Found this a very good spot for going south. Got dropped of, spotted a car with a french license plate and asked him if he was going to Paris. In the end he was going to Nantes. Less than 2 minutes waiting time for a 750km ride!
Fastest spot in Belgium I've been at
Stood there on the highway entree, got a ride within 10sec, towards Gent. Maybe helped that we where there during work-traffic hours (6/7pm)
It worked perfect for Gent, even if it was night!
Got a ride here from Bruges, and from here it was only a 5 minute wait to get a ride all the way to Brussels city center.

road to Brussels, liege, Gent...

short on-road, but people stop easily!

Sunday night 10:30pm, one girl, direction: Brussels.

Waited for less than 5 minutes at the end of the airport parking. Got a ride super fast into the center of Brussels.

Wednesday morning, 2 guys, direction Brussels

A lot of cars are passing by and most of them are going to Brussels, so we took direct ride there in less than 10 minutes. Very good spot, a lot of place for cars to stop.

it was 2.02.2015 around 5:12 pm but not in the day time when trying to catch a ride.take me about 10 minutes and goes me for 3,5 km until the roundabout in the front of Brussels Aviation School(Rue des Fusilles 1).
paradise folks
you can get to this service station by using the public transport and walking the last two kilometres by foot
service station, heavy traffic but perfect spot for cars to stop at the entrance to the motorway. 1 minute waiting time to go to direction gent/brugge, i even had the choice between to cars
The first lorry driver I asked took me.
direct ride to Brussels after 10 min.
Very nice and busy service station on E40 towards Brussels.

birds sing songs of freedom...

Good spot !

Not too many trucks in the middle of the day. Stood with a sign for LUX -> DE (STUTTGART) in the end of the station going south and eventually got a lift to Luxembourgh city. All the cars were packed, because people were going on vacations.

petrol station

I was hitching to Dunkerque, so this was not a right place (as I can see now). I was just lucky and found a driver directly to Oostende.
petrol station Q8
For Antwerp/Brussels accept any ride to Hasselt, all ramps in Hasselt or OK or better. Use sign Antwerp/Brussel.

We found this an excellent spot to get to antwerp from maastricht. about a half hour journey by bus from maastricht train/bus station (you need to catch the belgian bus, De Lijn, from i think stand K,L or M stopping at Bilzen). Wait at the start of the N700 just after the round about. There is a big service lane where cars/trucks etc can stop. Took us longer to write a sign than to get picked up! Was able to be taken to a town where the bus to antwerp was 2 euro.
N700 x N2. Hasselt, Antwerpen, Brussel.
Got a lift to a gas station outside of Mons in no time. Good place to go ask people.
A lot of traffic to the west. I was very lucky, waited 5 minutes

We're going from Gent to Leuven, we made a sing with "E40" Someone picked us up after 5 min. She was going to Affligem so she left us in a gas station just before her exit. In the petrol station it took us 10 minutes to found a ride, but my girlfriend comes from Belgium, my be harder if you ask it in English I guess. Gas stations on highways are always the best place to ask for a ride.

Very good spot to get to the highway. 
Is better if you make a sing with the number of the highway you are going, so they can leave you in a Petrol station on the highway if they are not going where you need to go.
Currently (summer 2016) this is the best spot at the airport to hitchhike from. Got here through the parking lot.
Good place with al lot of people

If you want to go along the N9 to Bruges, take bus 9 to Mariakerke, get of at 'staakskenstraat' and start hitchhiking on the bike lane. 
Using a sign will always improve chances you will get a ride. Overall time before pick up ranges from as little as 1 minute up to 30 minutes when my end destination was Eeklo.
Spot close to highway exit - both directions: Brugge/Gent. Place for cars to pullover.
Great spot in all directions - Gent, Brussel, Antwerp but also Oostende or Kortrijk. Place for cars to pull over.
It's the best point to leave Brussels and go to East. From Brussels-North, take the bus De Lijn 351 and stop in Nossegem-Centrum to stop there. You won't wait a long time.
Good place if you want to leave to Namur, or going to visit the incredible and wonderful Davistan!
The place to leave Profondecity in 5 minutes. Bus stop !

Easiest spot since long! We just arrived to the gas station. A woman came out and asked us: 'Where are you going?' 
We answered 'Aartselaar'. Perfect she said. :-)
Easy! Most of the people driving here are going to the highway. Space to stop at the entrance of the school.

Good. People are very friendly. Not all stop but it's easy to walk and hitchhike at the same time here... This was a good spot cause people could see us from a distance. We got a ride to Nijlen. (going to Gent).

In front of the gates Royal Palace of Laeken. Cars drive relatively slow, there are traffic lights a few meters before. Nearly all traffic going North. A lot of space for cars to stop. Officially cars aren't allowed to stop here, but the guards don't seem to care.

In the direction of Namur. Cars have to slow down, can easily see you and have enough place to stop ...

I've never waited more than five minutes

Cars coming from Aywaille have much time to see you, before going on the highway

it's easy to stop because there's an unused lane on the right side

Most people go to Liège, or ride along the Guillemins train station, close to which other spots exist (Namur, Bruxelles)

It still would be better if you had a sign !
Good spot here in the direction of Dinant. Big bus stop ...

Good spot if you want to go to Namur. Cars can stop at the bus stop ... and much traffic all day long because of the Carrefour shop !

also possible to hitchike in the other direction ... just cross the street and go to the bus stop !
Good spot in the direction of Profondeville and Dinant. Drivers can easily see you because there's a long strirpe where no car may get parked, just in front of the casino !

J'ai d'abord essayé sous le pont, pendant 10 minutes, mais les voitures n'ont pas le temps et le climat sonore est franchement désagréable! J'ai bougé de 20 metres et au bout d'a peine 5 minutes des francais qui allaient a Rouen se sont arretés et m'ont déposé sur la route de Paris. C'était un lundi à midi.

De Bruxelle centre, prendre le Tram 4 jusqu'a Stalle, puis marcher environ 15-20 minutes sur Hallestraat puis en direction du ring. A l'entrée de la bretelle du Ring a gauche après le pont, (et non au feu rouge sous le pont) pour aller en direction du Sud, notamment Lille, Paris ou Normandie. Les voitures ont le temps et la place pour s'arreter.
direction Kelmis/Vaals. Hard shoulder after the roundabout.
Just after the roundabout, direction Eupen. Plenty of space to stop.

it goes me to Herrmann-Debroux  metro station even he should to be at about 20 minutes away of that place.
help me also with the charger of battery iphone.

Take bus 5 or 6 and ask the driver to drop you off near to highway E40. Not many cars pass by but it should be possible to hitch a ride to the next gas station (10 k) and from there further east to Aachen, Liege (Luik) or Maastricht.
Good spot for going East. Got a lift to hear from the centre and then a another within 5 minutes. Not many cars were passing on a Saturday evening but can imagine it to be busy here at peak hours.
Very good place to go to Liege or even in direction to Luxembourg.
Good place to go Brussel or France. I got a car to Lille in 5 minits.
Very good place to go to the motorway E411(Bruxelles, Louvain-la-Neuve) and E40 (Liège,Charleroi). With a sign it's easier.
Accidentally appears here. Not a bad spot to Hasselt, the traffic is slow due to lights and there is plenty of space to stop. The only problem is access to the spot.

Nous cherchions à rentrer à Louvain-La-Neuve. On était 3 et il faisait noir. Il y a un feu de signalisation. On a attendu moins de 10 minutes. Quand le feu était rouge, on remontait la file de voiture avec notre panneau "LLN". Très vite, une dame nous a pris.
Agree...good spot just found the place that is good for cars to spot and you will get to Gent/Kortrijk soon.

The spot on the map is not placed properly, you have to pass under the highway and then stay just behind the McDonald's on the slip road.
Good place - not much traffic but easy to get to the huge gas station on the border.
to mechelen, 5 min to wait and bingo!
Took ~1h to get a ride from this spot to Brussels.

It's a nice place to leave Charleroi in the direction of Mons or Brussels (but it's very far from Charleroi).
I have made hitchhiking two times there and each time, after 1 ou 2 minutes, there was a driver has stopped for me.

C'est un bon spot pour quitter Charleroi en direction de Mons ou Bruxelles (même si l'endroit est assez loin de Charleroi).
J'ai fait du stop à cet endroit 2 fois, et à chaque fois, un conducteur s'est arrêté après une ou deux minutes.
Good ramp, usually for a short lift to Hasselt. Any of the ramps in Hasselt is fine for getting further towards Antwerpen or Brussels.
Good spot to HH towards Antwerp. Slow traffic after crossroad and enough place for the cars to stop.
This is the verry best way to go to Gent or further to Brussels. I have used it 2 times, the first time I was still writing my sign and there was already a car that stopped.

Go under the bridge and there is a ramp to go on the E40 to Gent/Antwerp/Brussels. But use a sign saying Gent, that is the closest and everybody is going there. There is enough place for cars to stap and you will find a ride easy!

Ramp n° 13 direction Antwerp, waiting time 10 minutes on a thursday sunny afternoon. Had a sign and was picked up by a couple. Offered me food and cigarettes. Dropped me off at Justice Palace. From there you can walk or use public transport to the centre of Antwerp.
Going IN to Brussels. The cars come 70 km/h, so they can stop.
Fine gas station with usable traffic. Got a ride to Gent after an hour.
to go to brussels or luxembourg
Pretty nice for a ride out to the A19 highway, for direction Kortrijk.
Very good place to Brugge, not to many cars, but drivers goes very slowly here.

just after the railway bridge you can find very easy a ride to Brugge.

in the direction of Gembloux and Louvain-la-Neuve.

indeed it is a good spot - if you're headed to england, you could start looking for cars with uk plates, but you'd be better off going to jabbeke near bruges.

Take bus 45 or another bus going to the university or walk to this spot. Do make a sign, because people can go quite a lot of different directions from this point. I got a ride to Maaseik in less then 1 minute!
Great gas station for HH! Found a ride to Antwerp and beyond very fast.
Used this spot two times this week, worked well each time. Stand in the light if it's dark !
Best spot to hitchhike South from Leuven. There's a bus from the centre till there. Always found a ride quickly from there. There's space for cars to stop.
To Antwerp.
Dropped off and instantly picked up and to Gent.

Service station with a shop, KFC and burger king.

Easy spot on the car parking near highway in direction of Germany close to the airport.

Third car to pass by picked me up. Wanted to take me to Ghent, but I declined.
Asked around for someone going to Utrecht, found a couple who brought me past Antwerp & dropped my of at a good spot!
A lot of space for cars to pull over. Cars either go north to liege or south to luxembourg
Dekt very small when some other ride brought me there. But I got lucky and I immidiatly got a ride to the exact place I needed to be!

Good spot, we just stood by the side of the road outside of the gas station. There was a traffic jam, so it was easier. Plenty of space for small cars to stop. We got ride in 5 minutes directly to Gent.

IN LUXEMBOURG? HEADING NORTH? Take their free transportation to get to this spot, it will always be faster than waiting at a gas station or somewhere between Luxembourg. Peace be with you groovy groovers.
I arrived near Brugge in one lift from here, a lot of place to park, a sign may be needed
2 cars in one minutes
Fantastic place to stop by for friendly people
good, safe, visible spot by the bus stop, cars aren't very fast there. deinitely use a sign if you'd like to go past antwerpen, otherwise thumb should be just fine :)
Service station, lots of car. We were 2 people going south and got a ride to luxembourg

Good spot with plenty of traffic where you can easily catch a ride as far as the Netherlands or France. This is a point where traffic can go any direction tho, so a sign is definitely recommended.
I got offered a ride to Paris in minutes (thumb) and one to the Netherlands not much later (sign).
Best spot to go to Gent ! A lot of car pass by the roundabout, easy for them to stop over
One of the best places i've come across on my trip in Belgium. The guy who stopped was so kind that he took me directly to hennuyeres. I left him a chocolate bar for the trouble of taking a detour.

After Landing and buying some water at the minimarket i waited 5 minutes total for the right ride! In just five minutes 2 cars stopped but the first one was returning to Charleroi and i wanted to go to Bruxelles. Once in Bruxelles there are plenty of tram buses and metro (7,5 euro per day or about 2 euro per ticket).
Lots of traffic going in the right direction. Good space for cars to stop. Medium speed. Good spot in my opinion.
Lots of traffic. Only a little space on the grass for cars to stop, but its okay.
Were hitchhiking and our driver stopped us here. We decided to try a bit and got a ride within 4 mins that is going towards the netherlands

Used this spot on 2 or 3 occasions to get to the train station in Edingen. Waiting time always under 10min. In any case it's a better option than to wait for the De Lijn buses that (supposedly) pass by every two hours.
Got to Arlon fairly quickly by Romanian workers.
Good spot to hitchhike to Brugge. There is a bus stop where cars can stop and there is enough traffic.
I didnt have enough time to write my sign and i got a ride. I think its the best spot to hitchhike to Gent. Lots of space for the cars to stop, enough traffic. Perfect!

Good for getting towards Hasselt/Genk/Liege/Aachen.

Slow traffic and some place to pullover. You can use this roundabout for all 4 directions.
I hitchhiked a bit further on the other side of the road. Got a ride to Peer after 5 minutes.
Was here twice. Very good spot to get to Leuven at least

There's nothing special about this spot, but for me, it's the spot where I have the lowest average waiting time. Hitchhiked here about 20 times and never waited longer than 2 minutes. Always used a sign.
Verry good place to go to Lier.
Even in rain I got a ride (although he was Asian and didn't spoke Dutch well)

Direction Lier: Good place, but most people drive to Mortsel or Boechout. You can also take the tram :)
Cars drive slowly and there's enough place to pull over. Got a ride within 2 minutes in darkness (during Sunrise Festival).
hold my hand out. first car stopped and brought me to Achen.
I swear we were gonna write a new sign and we just got picked up!!!
Lots of people stop and ask where you want to go, I could even be choosey and wait until I found a lift directly to Brussels.

Lots of cars going north, easy to stop. I had a sign with "North" on it and someone took me exactly where I wanted haha.
Great spot! Best to leave Antwerp! Lots of cars and place to stop. There is an entire lane closed for driving and cars can stop there. Sign required!
They added a lane on the on-ramp. It was easier to hitch there in the past when there was one one lane. I'd prefer the ramp near Crowne Plaza Hotel to go in direction of Liège, Eindhoven or Breda.
Was about to give up because the sun was setting but then I got a ride to Liège
Very good spot to join brussels, Charleroi or liege
Is just perfect to go to Brussels and Liege ! Cars have good space for stopping.
very good for brussels
Fantastic for Brussels, Liege. Very very high visibility. Cars have to stop next to you.
A pretty good spot, especially considering that it isn't a petrol or public transport station. (1 M, 1 F)
15 minute wait for E19 to Breda, very easy spot.
The 10th car stopped and brought me directly to Beringen. I used a sign 'E313 Beringen'.

Especially good during the week. I HH from here often on friday afternoon. Heading to the east: sometimes cars bring you immediately to the E313/E34, but if they aren't going the correct motorway, they can drop you off at the roundabout in Wommelgem. This doesn't work when the car is heading to the north (E19).

I've waited about 1 hour on Sunday , wanted to go in direction of Hasselt. It was better without sign as a guy who gave me a ride dropped me on Antwerpen ring but better place to hitch-hike to Hasselt.
Maybe my Liège sign was a bit optimistic because nearly everyone was going to Bruxelles. Eventually got a ride to Namur.
First car I asked gave me a ride to the petrol station in Rotselaar (E314)
